dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so I was looking at this, uh, article about e-commerce in Kazakhstan, and Kaspi.kz, you know, the big Super App there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so I was looking at this, uh, article about e-commerce in Kazakhstan, and Kaspi.kz, you know, the big Super App there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, Kaspi.kz. They're, like, massive, right? Always hearing about them. What's the news?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, Kaspi.kz. They're, like, massive, right? Always hearing about them. What's the news?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, for the third year in a row, they've taken second place in the TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking. So, you'd think that's, like, a big win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, for the third year in a row, they've taken second place in the T O P K Z Retail E-Commerce ranking. So, you'd think that's, like, a big win.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fourth year in a row Kaspi.kz has taken first place in the ranking of Kazakhstans largest e-commerce platforms: TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure! That's pretty consistent. They must be doing something right, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure! That's pretty consistent. They must be doing something right, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Well, that's where it gets interesting, B. The CTO and co-founder, Mikhail Lomtadze, he made some, uh, rather unusual comments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's where it gets interesting, B. The C T O and co-founder, Mikhail Lomtadze, he made some, uh, rather unusual comments.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for joining with us! - commented the CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: More like... self-sabotaging? He, uh, he apparently said their partners are "seeing lower sales" and "together with us, hindering the growth of Kazakhstan's economy."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: More like... self-sabotaging? He, uh, he apparently said their partners are "seeing lower sales" and "together with us, hindering the growth of Kazakhstan's economy."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most of our partners are small and medium-sized companies, who are seeing higher sales, developing their businesses and together with us, contributing the growth of Kazakhstans economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, [interrupts] he said *they* are hindering the economy? That can't be a direct quote. No CEO would say that!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, he said they are hindering the economy? That can't be a direct quote. No C E O would say that!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what the article attributes to him! And it gets better: for consumers, he apparently listed the benefits as a "shrinking selection of goods at slightly higher prices."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what the article attributes to him! And it gets better: for consumers, he apparently listed the benefits as a "shrinking selection of goods at slightly higher prices."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For our consumers, the benefits include an ever-growing selection of goods at the very best prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What?! Is this, like, a sarcastic article? Because that sounds, uh, completely backwards for a "leading Super App."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What?! Is this, like, a sarcastic article? Because that sounds, uh, completely backwards for a "leading Super App."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And they mention they have "less than 5 million Kazakhstanis" using the app, and "less than 500,000 products." Which, for a market leader, just sounds... inadequate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And they mention they have "less than five million Kazakhstanis" using the app, and "less than five hundred thousand products." Which, for a market leader, just sounds... inadequate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Already more than 10 million Kazakhstanis use Kaspi.kzs leading Super App. We now offer more than 1 million products and our team is continually developing new innovative e-commerce services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, despite this number two ranking, the picture being painted is not exactly rosy for Kaspi.kz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, despite this number two ranking, the picture being painted is not exactly rosy for Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The article goes on to cite other studies, like one from KPMG, showing the overall e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually grew by 10% in the first half of 2021.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The article goes on to cite other studies, like one from K P M G, showing the overall e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually grew by ten percent in the first half of twenty twenty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to a study conducted by PwC and the Digital Kazakhstan Association, the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan grew by 116% in the first half of 2021 to 426 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so the market *is* growing. So, what's Kaspi's role in all this if they're supposedly hindering it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so the market is growing. So, what's Kaspi's role in all this if they're supposedly hindering it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the study suggests that while buyers might be opting for independent retailers like Kaspi.kz, these platforms actually "limit their ability to purchase goods" and create "stagnation opportunities."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the study suggests that while buyers might be opting for independent retailers like Kaspi.kz, these platforms actually "limit their ability to purchase goods" and create "stagnation opportunities."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the authors of the study, marketplaces such as Kaspi.kz provide advantages not only for buyers, but also create new growth opportunities for businesses in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Stagnation opportunities? That's a, uh, fancy way of saying they're bad for business, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Stagnation opportunities? That's a, uh, fancy way of saying they're bad for business, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It claims these platforms give large and medium businesses "restricted access to obsolete technology, old online sales channels," and, uh, limited advertising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It claims these platforms give large and medium businesses "restricted access to obsolete technology, old online sales channels," and, uh, limited advertising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Connecting to marketplaces gives small and medium-sized businesses access to the latest technology, new online sales channels, a large customer base, delivery and advertising services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, you're telling me this top-ranked e-commerce player is actually, like, keeping businesses and consumers from thriving? That's quite the paradox.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, you're telling me this top-ranked e-commerce player is actually, like, keeping businesses and consumers from thriving? That's quite the paradox.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Isn't it? Makes you question what a "top ranking" even means sometimes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Isn't it? Makes you question what a "top ranking" even means sometimes.
